definition: gate/door/CL:扇[shan4]/gateway/doorway/CL:個|个[ge4]/opening/valve/switch/way to do something/knack/family/house/(religious) sect/school (of thought)/class/category/phylum or division (taxonomy)/classifier for large guns/classifier for lessons, subjects, branches of technology/(suffix) -gate (i.e. scandal; derived from Watergate)

sentences.english: Teachers in professional colleges must specialize in both theory and practice.
sentences.chinese: 職業大學師資必須是學深藝高的“雙師型”專門人才。

sentences.english: The university teachers shoulder for the society raise the qualified professional personnel's important mission.
sentences.chinese: 高校教師肩負爲社會培養合格專門人才的重要使命。

sentences.english: Some also face a shortage of expertise.
sentences.chinese: 一些公司也面臨着專門人才的短缺。

sentences.english: The butler turned and hurried into the house, slamming the door behind him.
sentences.chinese: 看門人拔腳朝屋裏跑去，門在他身後砰的一聲關上了。

sentences.english: Universities are an important base for training high-grade specialized talents.
sentences.chinese: 高校是培養高級專門人才的重要基地。

sentences.english: As she was wonderful- she married a door-keeper coming from the country.
sentences.chinese: 由於她是個“騷貨”，下嫁給一個墟落來的看門人。

sentences.english: And I have seen the eternal Footman hold my coat, and snicker.
sentences.chinese: 我曾眼見永恆的守門人接過我的大衣，然後竊笑。

sentences.english: The janitor staggered down the stairway, stunned and gasping.
sentences.chinese: 瞧門人驚呆了，喘着粗氣，搖搖擺晃地走下樓梯。

sentences.english: “He was a janitor in a bowling alley, ” Haggis told me.
sentences.chinese: “他是一個保齡球館看門人，”哈吉斯告訴我。

sentences.english: Yemeni interest in the star-crossed lovers touches on geopolitics, too.
sentences.chinese: 也門人對跨越界限又觸犯地緣政治的戀人也很感興趣。

sentences.english: If you mention my name to the door-keeper he will let you in.
sentences.chinese: 你要是對看門人提我的名字，他會放你進去的。

sentences.english: The old caretaker was always scolding and chiding.
sentences.chinese: 這個老看門人總是責罵，呵叱個沒完。

sentences.english: Year "Xin Zheng, " which means "the new, first month. "
sentences.chinese: 廈門人把農曆新一年的正月稱爲“新正”。

sentences.english: The porter distributes incoming letters to the offices.
sentences.chinese: 看門人向各個辦公室分發來信。

sentences.english: The watchman just laughs at these stories.
sentences.chinese: 看門人尤里則對這些故事嗤之以鼻。

sentences.english: He fairly hustled around to the side entrance, and was let in by the friendly door-keeper.
sentences.chinese: 他急急繞到側門，友好的看門人放他進了後臺。

definition: worthy or virtuous person/honorific used for a person of the same or a younger generation
surname Wu/area comprising southern Jiangsu, northern Zhejiang and Shanghai/name of states in Southern China at different historical periods
junior scholar or pupil in imperial China
surname Jin/the Jin Dynasties (265-420)/Western Jin 西晉|西晋[Xi1 Jin4] (265-316), Eastern Jin 東晉|东晋[Dong1 Jin4] (317-420) and Later Jin Dynasty (936-946)/short name for Shanxi province 山西[Shan1 xi1]

gate/door/CL:扇[shan4]/gateway/doorway/CL:個|个[ge4]/opening/valve/switch/way to do something/knack/family/house/(religious) sect/school (of thought)/class/category/phylum or division (taxonomy)/classifier for large guns/classifier for lessons, subjects, branches of technology/(suffix) -gate (i.e. scandal; derived from Watergate)
